amendment.description: Amendment sought to require a GAO study of the number of primary care physicians that would be trained as a result of the funding provided in the health care overhaul law compared to the number of physicians that would be trained should funding be eliminated or rescinded.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 2 printed in the Congressional Record to conduct a study of the number of primary care physicians that would be trained as a result of the funding provided in the health care overhaul law compared to the number of physicians that would be trained should funding be eliminated or rescinded.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Tonko amendment (A001) Failed by recorded vote: 186 - 231 (Roll no. 336).

action.text: Roll call votes on amendments in House
Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A001) offered by Mr. Tonko.
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Tonko amendment (A001) Failed by recorded vote: 186 - 231 (Roll no. 336).
